senses.ex: He felt weak after the marathon.

Tips.title: Physical Condition
Tips.description: Used to describe someone's low energy or strength, often due to illness or exertion.
Tips.example: After climbing the stairs, she was feeling weak and had to rest.

Tips.title: Avoid Overstatement
Tips.description: Describing someone as 'weak' could be seen as offensive if not true or exaggerated.
Tips.example: Calling the recovering patient weak may seem inconsiderate.

senses.de: Not convincing or not well reasoned

Tips.title: Critique Carefully
Tips.description: When describing an argument or idea as 'weak', be ready to offer specific reasons to avoid sounding dismissive.
Tips.example: I found his proposal weak because it lacked detailed planning.

Tips.title: Subjective Perception
Tips.description: What you consider a 'weak' argument may be persuasive to someone else; it's often a matter of personal judgment.
Tips.example: Some may see her stance as weak, while others might find it reasonable.

Tips.title: Leadership Qualities
Tips.description: Describes someone who lacks authority or confidence when guiding others.
Tips.example: His weak leadership resulted in team confusion and missed deadlines.

Tips.title: Not Strictly Negative
Tips.description: 'Weak' in some contexts could mean flexible or compassionate, rather than ineffective.
Tips.example: Her weak management style actually encouraged creative thinking.

senses.ex: This chair is weak already, so try not to sit on it.

Tips.title: Physical Objects
Tips.description: Often refers to objects that can't bear much weight or stress without breaking.
Tips.example: The weak bridge swayed dangerously under the heavy load of traffic.

Tips.title: Identify Weakness
Tips.description: Knowing an object's weak areas can prevent accidents or misuse.
Tips.example: Find the weak points in the fence to repair it effectively.

senses.de: Not able to resist temptation or withstand pressure
senses.ex: I have a weak spot for chocolate.

Tips.title: Emotional Vulnerability
Tips.description: Shows that even strong people have things that can sway or tempt them.
Tips.example: He was weak when it came to adopting stray animals, he just couldn't say no.

Tips.title: Selective Temptation
Tips.description: Illuminates that 'weak' can relate to specific temptations, not general lack of willpower.
Tips.example: Despite being disciplined about her diet, she had a weak spot for ice cream.

Debilitate.wordDefinition:
Debilitate means to weaken someone or something to the point that they are unable to function normally. For example, a disease that takes away a person's ability to walk or talk can be said to debilitate them.

While both words describe a kind of weakness, debilitate suggests a more severe and long-lasting form of weakness.

Weak can describe a variety of situations, while debilitate often describes a more specific kind of weakness.

Delicate.wordDefinition:
Delicate refers to something that is fragile and needs to be handled with care, while the word weak refers to something that lacks strength or power.

Delicate is applicable when referring to objects or situations that require gentle handling, such as delicate glassware or delicate flowers.

Delicate implies a sense of fragility, while weak implies a lack of strength.

Feeble.wordDefinition:
The difference between the words feeble and weak is that feeble usually describes something that is fragile or delicate, whereas weak describes something that lacks strength or power.

For example, a feeble old woman may have delicate bones and struggle to lift heavy objects. In contrast, a weak person may lack muscle strength and struggle to lift heavy weights at the gym.

Feeble is more applicable when describing something fragile, delicate or easily broken, while weak is more applicable when describing something lacking in physical or mental strength.

Fragile.wordDefinition:
Fragile refers to something that is delicate or easily breakable, while weak refers to something that lacks strength or power.

For example, a glass vase is fragile because it can easily break if dropped or mishandled. A person with a weak body may lack physical strength or durability.

Fragile usually describes physical objects or things that need to be handled with care, while weak can also describe the quality of a person's character, willpower, or resolve.

Frail.wordDefinition:
Frail usually means physically delicate or weak, often due to old age or illness.

It can refer to someone who is not strong or powerful, or to something that is not firm or durable. Both words can describe a person's physical state, but frail is more specific to those who are elderly or unwell, while weak can refer to anyone who is not strong.

Infirm.wordDefinition:
Infirm means someone who is physically or mentally weak and unable to take care of themselves.

Overall, infirmity is usually associated with physical and mental disabilities, while weakness can refer to a lack of strength in different areas of life.

Power.wordDefinition:
Power refers to the ability to control or influence others or events.

Power is applicable in situations where someone has control or influence, whereas weak is applicable in situations where someone lacks strength or capability.

Shaky.wordDefinition: Shaky refers to something that is unsteady, unstable or wobbly. For example, a shaky building or a shaky voice.

Vulnerable.wordDefinition:
Vulnerable means being open or susceptible to harm, while the word weak means lacking in strength or power.

When someone is vulnerable, they may be in a state of being easily hurt emotionally or physically. For instance, a person may feel vulnerable after experiencing a traumatic event or handing over trust to someone they do not know well.

Often, when we hear the word vulnerable, it suggests a temporary moment where someone or something might be at risk of harm.

In summary, vulnerability refers to someone or something that is open to potential harm, while weakness is a more general statement about a lack of strength or ability.

videos.Text: Stage and screen engage some of our senses directly. We see and hear the interactions of the characters and the setting. But with prose fiction, all you have is static symbols on a contrasting background. If you describe the story in matter of fact, non-tactile language, the spell risks being a weak one.

quotes.Text: One truth stands firm. All that happens in world history rests on something spiritual. If the spiritual is strong, it creates world history. If it is weak, it suffers world history.
quotes.Title: German Theologian
quotes.Name: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.Text: Strong managers who make tough decisions to cut jobs provide the only true job security in today's world. Weak managers are the problem. Weak managers destroy jobs.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jack Welch

quotes.Text: Passion is what gets you through the hardest times that might otherwise make strong men weak, or make you give up.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: Me showing my emotions... it's not a sign of weakness; it's a sign of passion.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: Ashley Nell Tipton

quotes.Text: I don't worry about people misinterpreting my kindness for weakness.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jason Bateman

quotes.Text: It's more important to know your weaknesses than your strengths.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Ray Lee Hunt

quotes.Text: Never build your emotional life on the weaknesses of others.
quotes.Title: Spanish Philosopher
quotes.Name: George Santayana

quotes.Text: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.
quotes.Title: German Physicist
quotes.Name: Albert Einstein

quotes.Text: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Jean de la Bruyere

quotes.Text: My body gets weak without truth.
quotes.Title: Russian Writer
quotes.Name: Andrei Platonov
